result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: AMENDED Trial Scheduling Order Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 10/17/22
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 10/17/22

Jury status hearing on December 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Speedy Demand was reinstated orally on the record at the 10/17/2022 Hearing.

10:33 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Bobby P Somsak in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Bobby P Somsak.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes there is Defense Motion to Adjourn Trial to address today.  Atty. Bonneson confirms and also notes he also filed a motion to modify bail as well in 22CF1437.  Court will first address the Motion to Adjourn the Trial.  Atty. Bonneson presents arguments and is asking to have the 11/29/2022 jury trial be adjourned.  Court makes a good cause finding to adjourn the 11/29/2022 jury trial.  Atty. Bonneson advises he is still waiting on some additional discovery.  State notes that paper discovery as well as some additional discovery was mailed to Atty. Bonneson so he should have it shorty.  State notes that 22CF1437 also has discovery which was provided to prior counsel.  Atty. Bonneson notes he did not get the discovery in 22CF1437 from prior counsel.  State will re-prepare discovery from 22CF1437 and send it to current counsel.  Atty. Bonneson notes he is also still waiting on drug testing results from the Crime Lab.  State does not have those either and will reach out to the Crime Lab to see where the report is.  Court recommends setting both matters for status in December.  Atty. Bonneson notes his client may want to re-instate his Speedy Trial demand in this matter and have the matter scheduled accordingly.  Court will accept the Speedy Trial Demand being reinstated, with the time beginning starting today.  Court will set a new jury status and trial date in this matter.  Atty. Bonneson notes his client also is requesting a Speedy Trial in 22CF1437 as well.  Court will set both matters for a jury status and trial date, noting they are not joined cases.  Court to prepare and sign a pretrial order.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial, filed by Attorney Bonneson.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: 3:54 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Bobby P Somsak in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Bobby P Somsak. Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes this matter was set for status to tag along with 22CF1437.  Atty. Bonneson raises some concerns with respect to scheduling and notes he was just appointed to both matters.  Atty. Bonneson presents additional statements and requests to withdraw as counsel.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny Atty. Bonneson's request to withdraw as counsel.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled motion hearing, jury status, and jury trial dates in this matter.  Court will also maintain the currently scheduled further proceedings date on 10/17/2022 to address the jury status and trial dates in this matter.  Court also advises Atty. Bonneson to discuss the case with his client and the PD's office and if he still wants to withdraw from the case he needs to file a formal motion to withdraw prior to the next court date.
Hearing on October 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Letter from Attorney Bonneson requesting that the hearing scheduled for 10/5/2022 be rescheduled to the afternoon on the same date.
Attorney Paul Bonneson
Hearing on October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:29 AM Defendant Bobby P Somsak in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
DDA Boese states that the offer given to the Defendant contemplated waiving prelim; offer is now revoked. 
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Justin Rowe, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by DDA Boese.
Cross examination by attorney Menden.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
The Defendant enters a demand for speedy trial.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
